subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: just joined - where do i start?
msgSnippet: Paige, What a nice resource.  In going over the archives, I know that the production of this news is not easy.  I have made a copy of today s news and scanning
messageBody:
Paige,

What a nice resource. In going over the archives, I know that the
production of this news is not easy. I have made a copy of today's news
and scanning it, realize that I still have a way to go. (I am beginning
chapter 6 of "Alice in Quickscript."

Of course, the first thing through my brain is "how did they do that."
Well, enough time for that later.

Rick

pgabhart wrote:
>
>
> Rick:
>
> Welcome back to the group. I hope you find everything you need to
> become fully bi-alphabetical.
>
> You should try the QS news. It is not perfect yet, but it lets you read
> the latest Assoc. Press news stories with just the occasional "huh" for
> a peculiar QS spelling. Here is the link:
>
> http://quikscript.sourceforge.net/qs_american_news.pdf
> <http://quikscript.sourceforge.net/qs_american_news.pdf>
>
> Constant practice is what's needed to develop your reading speed.
>
> Indolence being a prime Human attribute, I know it is difficult to
> convince a literate individual to learn a new alphabet, but I encourage
> our members to talk QS up. Let others see you using it and answer their
> queries. Who knows when it will light a spark in another person?
>
> Paige Gabhart
>
> Risk wrote:
>
>> Greetings from Texas!
>>
>> I have been reading Peter's Alice in Wonderland this last week. It is
>> a wonderful way to learn the alphabet. Many thanks for making it
>> available.
>>
>> I have been absent from the Shavian and Quickscript lists for several
>> years now, doing this and that. Back then I was more interested in
>> Shavian, but have come back to learn Quickscript again.
>>
>> Looking forward to becoming comfortable with it all again.
>>
>> Rick
>>
>> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
>> <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>, "peter_r_guinness" <malt99@...>
>> wrote:
>> >
>> > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
>> <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>, "B.C. Siegl" <bcsiegl@> wrote:
>> > >
>> > > Hi, I just joined the group and am interested in learning QS. Where
>> > do i
>> > > start?
>> > > Thanks in advance.
>> > > BcS
>> > >
>> >
>> > You could try my Alice-in-Wonderland tutorials here:
>> >
>> http://members.optusnet.com.au/~malt99/project_quickscript_website/inde
>> <http://members.optusnet.com.au/%7Emalt99/project_quickscript_website/inde>
>> > x.html
>> > But please note that the tutorials use the General Australian accent
>> > (eg: they drop the rhotic R so that it is quicker and easier for
>> > Australians to learn).
>> >
>>
>
>
